0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Bovine immunoglobulin is a medical food dispensed by prescription under medical supervision; medical foods do not have to undergo premarket review or approval by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and individual medical food products do not have to be registered with the FDA
  • Disorder of intestine: 1 packet (5 g) ORALLY once daily OR one-half packet (2.5 g) ORALLY twice daily; may increase up to 4 packets per day

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Bovine immunoglobulin is a medical food dispensed by prescription under medical supervision; medical foods do not have to undergo premarket review or approval by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and individual medical food products do not have to be registered with the FDA
  • Disorder of intestine: 2 years or older, one-half packet (2.5 g) ORALLY once daily or in divided doses

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: hypersensitivity (allergy) to beef or any product components

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Immunologic:
  • -- allergy to beef protein; use is contraindicated

sub.title: Pregnancy Category
sub.mono: Fetal risk cannot be ruled out. (TH)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Bovine immunoglobulin is useful in the management of enteropathy due to its ability to bind microbial components, manage gastrointestinal immune balance, maintain gut barrier function, and improve nutrient utilization. It also increases lean body mass, protein utilization, and nutrient absorption while decreasing protein catabolism and fecal fat and energy loss.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
  • Mix 1 packet in at least 4 ounces (120 mL) of water or other liquid; stir to mix; do not shake
  • May blend with foods such as pudding or yogurt instead of mixing with liquid
  • Use immediately after mixing

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: No specific monitoring has been determined.

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Side effects may include abdominal cramps, constipation, nausea, or increased urination.
  • Counsel patient to mix powder in water, other liquids, or soft foods (pudding, yogurt) and consume immediately. Mixture should not be stored.
